benchmark_details.name: ASR4REAL: An Extended Benchmark for Speech Models
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a set of benchmarks matching real-life conditions in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) to identify biases and weaknesses in models, particularly focusing on performance discrepancies by accent and socio-economic status.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark that allows researchers to identify strengths and weaknesses of their ASR models in real-world settings.

data.source: The benchmark utilizes various datasets such as Librispeech, ALLSSTAR, NISP, VoxPopuli, Buckeye, and CORAAL for testing ASR models in different conditions.

methodology.calculation: The WER was normalized by speaker to account for the distribution of speaker characteristics.
methodology.interpretation: Lower WER indicates better model performance, with a focus on robustness across diverse conditions.
methodology.validation: Cross-comparison of several ASR models and systems under varied testing conditions.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis shows performance discrepancies based on accent and socio-economic status of speakers.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark addresses harm related to biases in ASR systems, particularly highlighting disparities in performance based on speaker characteristics.
